intro: Chaerefolium anthriscus, commonly known as the lesser cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and flies.
